{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3586642,"name":"Jun Yu","username":"juny","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/juny/{size}/258387_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-10T17:35:25.590Z","cooked":"

Hi! Our team has a swerve subsystem with YAGSL and 8 NEO motors, CAN Spark MAX, and 4 CANCoders, and we’re currently considering migrating to the CTRE Swerve solution as we think it would provide a smoother experience in programming and better features.

Our original plan is to replace 8 NEO motors with 8 Kraken X60 that have integrated Talon FX inside, and replace our NavX gyro with Pigeon 2.0. This seems to be a good solution because we already have MK4 Swerve modules.

However, we also learned that we can replace Spark MAX with Talon FXS because Talon FXS also provides support for Third-party NEO motors. It would be cheaper (about $80 cheaper for each) than replacing motors. But at the same time, I am also wondering if there would be a better performance/experience with all CTRE devices, or would that be a better long-term investment to change to Kraken?

Thanks!

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"updated_at":"2025-04-10T17:35:25.590Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":7,"reads":210,"readers_count":209,"score":82.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":498689,"topic_slug":"migrating-our-swerve-to-ctre-replacing-motors-or-controllers","display_username":"Jun Yu","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":74913,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":false},{"id":3586807,"name":"Stewart Riley","username":"Strategic","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/strategic/{size}/10157_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-10T18:13:31.293Z","cooked":"

The experience of using all CTRE devices is very smooth. If you have the money (and it’s worth it, seriously) then change to Kraken motors. They’re way more powerful than Neos and the integrated controllers make the swerve modules more compact. We used Kraken X60s for drive motors this year, but used Kraken X44s for steering motors. Saves a bit of weight and the X44s are a bit cheaper than X60s but do the steering job just fine. We also switched from the NavX to the Pigeon2, which proved to be a good choice. Going for the all CTRE system made everything easier.

juny:

I am also wondering if there would be a better performance/experience with all CTRE devices

You absolutely would have a better experience with CTRE devices! There are less workarounds needed and an overall more capable system. I highly encourage this if you can

You could also run FXS+Neo on steering and Kraken on drive. Krakens are overkill power-wise for steering, even more so than Neos.

FXS + Neo will be pretty indistinguishable from Kraken x60 for almost all uses.

The primary issue reported by people I know that still use that motor pairing is ability to maintain accurate odometry in drive applications.

I’ve never experienced that issue using CTRE motors in my drivetrain.
